com.codepotato.model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codepotato.model.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Player is responsible for controlling playback of an audiofile. It contains an instance of the EffectChain so that effects can be applied during playback.
    Author:
    Michael Santer

      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.io.File audioFile)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.io.File audioFile)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        audioFile - Given an audio file, of type File, the constructor initializes a new sampleReader for reading the file, a new AudioTrack for playback, and gets the current instance of the EffectChain.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns:
        True if audio is playing, false if it is not playing.

      • play

        public void play()
        Tells the player to start playing. This automatically spawns a new thread. play() calls run() to start playback in a new thread. During playback this method reads a sample from SampleReader, runs that sample through the effect chain, then writes it to the AudioTrack for plaback.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Stops playback, while maintaining the current playback position. Kills the thread that was started by play().

      • seek

        public void seek(int location)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        location - Given a location between 0 and 100 %, seek() will move playback to the appropriate position in the audio file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • seekToBeginning

        public void seekToBeginning()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        A convenience method that returns the playback to the beginning.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • audioLength

        public int audioLength()
        Returns:
        Total length of current audio track in seconds.

      • currPositionPercent

        public int currPositionPercent()
        Returns:
        current position of playback in percent from 0-100
